candidates.title: Preparing for Release v0.8.0
candidates.body:
Remaining things to do:
- Update `ndarray` to `1.61.1`
- Make most dependencies depend on the specific version number (no surprises!)
- Cleanup `CHANGELOG.md`.
- [x] Wait for #906

candidates.title: fix: Backports, R-devel WARNINGs
candidates.body:
This PR addresses new WARNINGs in r-devel which require creating backports. 

Creating backports and new binding versions using libR-sys is a bit too much of a lift and is becoming too frequent of a task. To that end this PR introduces a new crate `extendr-ffi` and removes the dependency on `libR-sys` for both `extendr-api` and `extendr-engine`. 

`extendr-ffi` is a hand-curated set of bindings taken from `libR-sys`. It contains _only_ the bindings that are used by extendr and extendr-engine. Additionally it adds a `non-api` feature which is used by the extendr-api `non-api` feature. Previously the `non-api` feature in extendr-api could not compile due to manual removal of non-API functions from libR-sys. 

The new approach using extendr-api resolves this. Additionally, there is no need to use precomputed bindings simplifying the build process _greatly_ across all distributions. I suspect this will mean that integration with webR will be much simpler. 

Using `extendr-ffi` also can provide a path forward to closing https://github.com/extendr/extendr/issues/583

## Fixes 

- Closes https://github.com/extendr/extendr/issues/896 and all sub-issues
- Closes https://github.com/extendr/extendr/issues/889
- Closes https://github.com/extendr/extendr/issues/364
- Closes https://github.com/extendr/extendr/issues/677

## Deadline

CRAN packages that use extendr have a deadline of April 14th to remediate the issues. As such there is a bit of urgency to ensure that this gets addressed so we can try and make PRs to affected users' GitHub repositories.

candidates.title: chore: bump faer to 0.20
candidates.body: This PR bumps the faer version to 0.20 to address issues with faer compilation on CI.

candidates.title: Try again: Type-checking `ExternalPtr<T>` by downcasting..
candidates.body:
This is an alternative to #852. This is clearly a more convoluted approach, but it seems to be the approach that Rust prefers.


~~This PR currently does not pass CI. It fundamentally changes how `ExternalPtr<T>` works. And there were assumptions about this in `#[extendr]`-impl, that needs to be adjusted.~~ Done.

candidates.title: Add `PartialEq` for `Rstr`
candidates.body:
Addition: It is not possible to compare `Rstr` to `Rstr` like the R interpreter does.

This PR adds that comparison. 

The case for this emerges when you want to take advantage of the fact that R has a string interner, which means that equality of strings can fall on the pointer address directly, instead of comparing the actual character bytes.

Use-case: 
Constructing a `HashSet<Rstr>` should be faster (with this) than constructing a `HashSet<&str>`. 
Caveat here is that the `Hash` for `Rstr` needs to be implemented, but this is a crucial bit...

candidates.title: Patch release PR: 0.7.1
candidates.body:
I just made a release of `extendr-macros`, `extendr-api` and `extendr-engine` on crates.io based on this PR.
Patched version to make things compile everywhere (CRAN, in CI, rextendr, etc.)

candidates.title: Lower MSRV for CRAN Compliance
candidates.body:
This PR lowers extendr's MSRV to 1.65 making it compatible with CRAN.

It is not no longer possible to build bindings by way of `cargo`-features.

The feature `non-api` is fully broken, and enabling it won't compile.

candidates.title: [internal] Adjust path for `extendrtests`
candidates.body:
The path in `tests/extendrtests/src/rust/Cargo.toml` is very obscure.

I don't know who it serves.

With `xtask`, we adjust this in a process, to make it work with `devtools` and `rcmdcheck`.

Now, I ask that we merge this, so that it works when one is developing extendr, in the repository as workspace/working-directory, and when in vscode,

```json
{
    "rust-analyzer.linkedProjects": [
        "tests/extendrtests/src/rust/Cargo.toml",
    ]
}
```

I ask you to merge this as soon as possible, because I'm tired of things being set in an unhelpful way.

candidates.title: [urgent] Update non-API for CRAN
candidates.body:
CRAN compliance PR.

Background: CRAN has new requirements for what is non-API. These requirements just came up and became defacto law of the land. They are not tied to any R release. We just have to deal with it.

We pulled non-API list in 
https://github.com/extendr/libR-sys/pull/248

This PR syncs `libR-sys` with this commit.

- Hid previous available functionality behind `non-api` feature. It means, if you want it, you may compile `extendr-api` with `feature = ["non-api"]`. This requires you to build your own bindings by way of `libR-sys` as wel.
- Moved all doc-tests to `non_api_tests`, and in order to make that work, I had to add an entry for it in `extendr-api/Cargo.toml`. Note that the `optional`-module in integration tests doesn't work. And it needs to also have an entry to work.
- I also added `required-features`, but this doesn't run the test _unless_ the feature is provided to the `cargo test`-call. So these tests are present, but won't run. We have to have a broader conversation about testing `non-api`. For now, this is a patch, that allows us to rediscover missing features if users want them.

candidates.title: Updates libR-sys
candidates.body: Closes #797

candidates.title: Remove `libR-sys` from extendrtests permanently
candidates.body:
Fixes #787 

As agreed, we now prefer `R_HOME` in `tests/extendrtests` or if R is available from `PATH`.

It is reasonable enough, to assume that the contributors to extendR, will have configured their terminal to have R available there.

candidates.title: [urgent!] `#[extendr]`-impl requires `libR-sys`
candidates.body:
Currently on `master`,  `#[extendr]`-impl requires that the user have `libR-sys` as a dependency to compile. **This is a big problem**

The culprit is the extraction of a reference / mutable reference from `Robj`. We use something
from `libR-sys` directly, thus the user needs to have `libR-sys` available.
We do not export `libR-sys`, so we can't depend on it by way of `extendr-api`. Meaning, there is no `pub use libR_sys;` in `extendr-api`. I don't think we should do that either.

Instead, I think we should unify the interface of `#[extendr]`-impl to fully embrace `ExternalPtr<T>`.

This is what this PR is about!

## Details

I take a `&Robj`, turn that (unsafely) to `&ExternalPtr<T>`, and from there I extract (unsafely) the `&T`.
Similarly, this is done for `&mut T`.
To ensure that this is okay, we have to make `ExternalPtr<T>` transparent.

**Going from `&Robj` to `ExternalPtr<T>`**: The `Robj` could be something else than an `externalptr`. One could have put in a `list()` instead. Thus, we make a type-check on `externalptr`-type.

**Going from `&ExternalPtr<T>` to `&T`**: The pointer may be `NULL`.

All of these conditions has been unified in an error-aware chain of calls. All the low-level pointer
manipulations has been replaced by Rust approved abstraction.
_There is one more abstraction that we can employ, the `NonNull<T>` one.. But let us wait on that for another PR.

Finally, the finalizer has been removed, because we can rely on `ExternalPtr<T>`, and its clean way of doing this. To that end, `ExternalPtr<T>` was missing an `Attributes`-impl.

## Conclusion

Actually there is way more: We urgently need to approve this, but what is more important,
is to remove the dependency of `libR-sys` from our integration test crate `tests/extendrtests/src/rust`. This can be done, but it is going to be a bit contentious. I'll do that in a follow-up PR.

candidates.title: Update CHANGELOG
candidates.body: We haven't updated changelog since #706 or #754

candidates.title: Various maintenance
candidates.body:
- [x] Added `non-api` option that exposes functionality that was considered API prior to R 4.4. We are marking these `unsafe`. This is considered a breaking change.
- [x] As we are now testing multiple versions of R, actively, we may switch to R environments that does not have all the necessary packages for development.
This PR adds a check and prints a message with the useful command-line instruction to install missing packages.
- [x] I've also added instructions for using development versions of extendr, with rextendr in `tests/extendrtests/README.md`. 
- [x] This PR became contingent on this https://github.com/extendr/rextendr/pull/352

candidates.body: This relies on https://github.com/extendr/libR-sys/pull/233

candidates.title: `xtask` add more features
candidates.body:
I've added a bunch of extra features to the `xtask`. There are many changes lines, but these should be complete, in the sense that they won't require too much exploration to review.

Also, I'm trying to out as a out to migrate changes from the "fork" to `master`.

- Added a `cargo extendr fmt` that uses `cargo fmt` / `rustfmt` on both the crates in the workspace, plus `tests/extendrtests/src/rust` as well. We rarely format that integration-test crate.
- Added `cargo extendr devtools-test -a` which will "accept" the newly generated macros from a given build. We will see the changes in the PR, but this will help contributors. The workflow is imagined to be: `cargo extendr devtools-test`, that then tests things, and a potential new `macro-snapshot.md` is generated. Then one is supposed to call `cargo extendr devtools-test -a` to accept the snapshot, and perform testing _again_, just in case.
- Added `cargo extendr document`, which is a feature to run `rextendr::document()` for the `tests/extendrtests`-package. In the fork, I've vendored the `rextendr` crate, which makes it possible to have a consistent contributor-experience, if one is changing `rextendr` simultaneously.

candidates.title: Introduce optional faer support
candidates.body: This PR introduces optional support for `faer::Mat<f64>` into and from a `Robj` in order to integrate with the [faer](https://github.com/sarah-ek/faer-rs) crate.
